snippet: Baby boomers are finding themselves drawn to condos at retirement communities where prices have plunged since the recession.
abstract: Baby boomers are finding themselves drawn to condos at retirement communities where prices have plunged since recession; trend has surprised many experts in real estate, who thought that allure of such retirement communities was a thing of the past.

byline.original: By HOWARD GOODMAN and MICHAEL WINERIP
byline.contributor: Howard Goodman reported from Boca Raton, Fla., and Michael Winerip from New York.

lead_paragraph: Baby boomers are finding themselves drawn to condos at retirement communities where prices have plunged since the recession.

headline.seo: At Florida Condos, Too Young to Retire but Not to Grab a Deal
headline.main: Too Young to Retire, but These Deals Can’t Wait
headline.print_headline: Too Young to Retire, but These Deals Can’t Wait
